snippet: Jonathan Rieder of Barnard College argues that the public Dr. King cannot be understood without understanding how he preached to black congregations.
abstract: Samuel G Freedman On Religion column notes work of Dr Jonathan Rieder, one of most astute scholars of Rev Dr Martin Luther King, who argues that King cannot be understood without understanding how he preached to black congregations; Rieder's book Gospel of Freedom traces evolution of both I Have A Dream speech and Letter From Birmingham Jail through years of his obscure sermons.
lead_paragraph: Jonathan Rieder of Barnard College argues that the public Dr. King cannot be understood without understanding how he preached to black congregations.

headline.print_headline: In Gospel Songs of Yore, Clues to the Speeches of Martin Luther King Jr.
headline.main: In Gospel Songs of Yore, Clues to the Speeches of Martin Luther King Jr.
